byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

abstract: The deal is the latest by Chinese energy companies flocking to acquire stakes in Canada's oil-rich resources.
snippet: The deal is the latest by Chinese energy companies flocking to acquire stakes in Canada's oil-rich resources.
lead_paragraph: Sinopec of China agreed on Sunday to buy Daylight Energy, a Canadian oil and natural gas producer, for about $2.1 billion in cash, as Chinese companies increasingly flock to Canada's oil-rich resources.

headline.main: Sinopec to Buy Daylight Energy for $2.1 Billion
